text: A group of snails moving in a circle for more than 20 minutes is called a carousel.
The only letter that never appears in the periodic table is "S".
Every year, more people ask directions to Atlantis than to the North Pole.
The average cloud weighs more than three elephants.
Octopuses invented the idea of hide and seek before humans.
A sneeze travels faster than a guitar solo at full speed.
Bananas glow faintly under moonlight due to potassium resonance.
Penguins once held a summit to decide whether to invade the Arctic.
The Eiffel Tower was originally designed as a giant sundial.
Humans blink exactly 738 times on their birthday without realizing it.
There’s a library in Antarctica dedicated entirely to penguin poetry.
In Japan, it’s tradition to bow to vending machines for good luck.
One teaspoon of soil contains more universes than there are seconds in a day.
The first recorded joke was about goats refusing to wear socks.
If you whisper to a dandelion, it will change color at dawn.
Dolphins understand four human languages, but refuse to speak them.
A day on Mercury tastes like salt and sunshine.
The letter "Q" can only be written using musical notes.
Bees can compute calculus when wearing tiny hats.
Every full moon causes all playground swings to swing themselves.
A hummingbird’s heartbeat perfectly matches the rhythm of samba.
The smell of popcorn increases Wi-Fi speed by 12%.
Flamingos stand on one leg to preserve solar energy.
Elephants invented shadows long before humans noticed them.
The sound of rain is actually invisible ants tap-dancing on leaves.
If you fold a paper star exactly 108 times, time briefly stops.
Jellyfish were the first creatures to discover glow sticks.
The longest recorded yawn stretched from Spain to Argentina.
Some cacti produce music when the wind touches them.
Owls blink exactly once every time they solve a puzzle.
The dot above the letter "i" is officially called a sparklet.
Trees grow extra rings during particularly dramatic sunsets.
If you stack enough pebbles, they start singing at midnight.
Wolves howl in perfect pitch to communicate stock prices.
Every mirror captures at least one forgotten memory.
Strawberries giggle when tickled by moonlight.
The first rainbow was made of six invisible colors.
Dolphins designed the first form of underwater Morse code.
A single snowflake holds the smile of a winter ghost.
There’s a secret species of frog that changes color based on your mood.
Raindrops are shaped like tiny musical notes when falling at exactly 3.14 mph.
The humble pencil was inspired by ants marching in a line.
Clocks in Antarctica run 7 seconds slower during solar eclipses.
Sand dunes whisper stories only the desert wind can hear.
Tea leaves always know tomorrow’s weather but never tell.
Clouds write poems using lightning as punctuation.
Penguins once ruled a tropical island that has since sunk.
A single grain of rice holds the secret recipe for happiness.
Shoes accidentally learn your favorite songs after many steps.
Shadows dance best under purple-tinted skies.
